titlepage.titleproper: Outer Banks History Center Ephemera CollectionPC.5276
titlepage.author: State Archives of North Carolina

did.unittitle: Outer Banks History Center Ephemera Collection
did.container: Outer Banks History Center Ephemera Collection
Outer Banks History Center Ephemera Collection
did.abstract: The Ephemera Collection, 1798-2019 and undated, contains ephemera (printed documents, created for a specific, limited purpose, and generally designed to be discarded after use) primarily related to the state of North Carolina and its counties, with a particular focus on Dare County. The collection was assembled over a period of several decades by Outer Banks History Center staff. Materials primarily document the history of Dare County and the State of North Carolina. Several notable Dare County organizations (such as the Roanoke Island Historical Association), events (such as the Pirates Jamboree and commemorations of the Wright Brothers' first flight), businesses (such as hotels, restaurants, and retail stores), and other entities are documented in the collection. The collection especially focuses on the tourism industry in North Carolina, both on and along the North Carolina Coast and throughout the state. Additionally, the collection includes historical materials relating to the University of North Carolina System and materials created by national and federal entities, such as the United States Coast Guard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Ephemera Collection is arranged into four series: North Carolina Counties, 1798-2019 and undated; State of North Carolina, 1825-2016 and undated; University of North Carolina System, 1857-2010; and United States, 1932-2016. The first two series are further divided into subseries.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the authors of these materials, or their descendants, as stipulated by the United States copyright law (Title 17 US Code). Individual researchers are responsible for using these materials in conformance with copyright law as well as any donor restrictions accompanying these materials.

processinfo.head: Processing
processinfo.p: Processed by Samantha Crisp, May 2018. Updated by Samantha Crisp, June 2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical
bioghist.p: The Ephemera Collection was assembled over a period of several decades by Outer Banks History Center staff. Materials in the collection dating prior to the 1990s appear to have been collected primarily by David Stick, while materials from more recent decades were collected and added by individual Outer Banks History Center staff members. The collection primarily documents the history of Dare County and the State of North Carolina. Several notable Dare County organizations (such as the Roanoke Island Historical Association), events (such as the Pirates Jamboree and commemorations of the Wright Brothers' first flight), businesses (such as hotels, restaurants, and retail stores), and other entities are documented in the collection. The collection especially focuses on the tourism industry in North Carolina, both on and along the North Carolina Coast and throughout the state. Additionally, the collection includes historical materials relating to the University of North Carolina System and materials created by national and federal entities, such as the United States Coast Guard.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The Ephemera Collection was assembled over a period of several decades by Outer Banks History Center staff with donations received from various donors. Much of the collection appears to have come from David Stick. Most materials from the 1990s-2010s were received in the mail or collected from community events by Outer Banks History Center staff members.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], PC.5276, Ephemera Collection, Outer Banks History Center, Manteo, NC, U.S.A.

relatedmaterial.p: Dare Coast Pirates Jamboree Collection from the Outer Banks History Center,(collection 5305)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
The Ephemera Collection, 1798-2019 and undated, contains ephemera (printed documents, created for a specific, limited purpose, and generally designed to be discarded after use) primarily related to the state of North Carolina and its counties. The largest portion of the collection documents Dare County and its organizations, businesses, and events. Materials in this collection include brochures, pamphlets, flyers, event programs, posters, articles and clippings, circulars, campaign flyers, memorabilia, reports, and other printed material documenting the state of North Carolina from the mid-19th century to the present.
The Ephemera Collection is arranged into four series: North Carolina Counties, 1798-2019 and undated; State of North Carolina, 1825-2016 and undated; University of North Carolina System, 1857-2010; and United States, 1932-2016.

controlaccess.corpname: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The first series of the Ephemera Collection contains materials related to North Carolina's local communities, businesses, organizations, and events. These materials are arranged by county. The documents in this subseries primarily consist of promotional flyers, brochures, event programs, pamphlets, clippings, and other ephemera related to individual businesses, organizations, or other entities within each county. The largest subseries in this series contains documents related to Dare County, including materials on the Roanoke Island Historical Association and The Lost Colony, travel guides created by the Dare County Visitors Bureau and Outer Banks Visitors Bureau, political ephemera, pamphlets and brochures related to real estate and vacation rentals in Dare County, and information on local churches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes a document approving travel for a local citizen, Arthur Jones, and guaranteeing against the spread of smallpox during the Edenton smallpox outbreak of 1798.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains flyers for gubernatorial candidate Locke Craig, who ran on a white supremacy platform in the 1912 election.

did.unittitle: Organizations: Committee for a Mid-County Bridge
did.container: Organizations: Committee for a Mid-County Bridge

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Dare County materials comprise the largest subseries in North Carolina Counties series. Materials in this subseries were largely created to in support of the Outer Banks tourism industry, and primarily consist of pamphlets, brochures, event flyers, and other promotional material. This subseries includes documentation of the Roanoke Island Historical Association and The Lost Colony, travel guides created by the Dare County Visitors Bureau and Outer Banks Visitors Bureau, political ephemera, pamphlets and brochures related to real estate and vacation rentals in Dare County, and information on local churches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials documenting various Dare County organizations, clubs, and groups. Materials primarily consist of promotional brochures, flyers, and event programs, although some folders may contain meeting minutes or other administrative material.

did.unittitle: Algonquian Indians of North Carolina, Inc
did.container: Algonquian Indians of North Carolina, Inc

did.unittitle: Dare County League of Women Voters
did.container: Dare County League of Women Voters

did.unittitle: Man Will Never Fly Memorial Society
did.container: Man Will Never Fly Memorial Society

did.unittitle: Outer Banks Forum for the Lively Arts
did.container: Outer Banks Forum for the Lively Arts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Roanoke Island Historical Association (RIHA) is primarily charged with overseeing the annual production of Paul Green's symphonic outdoor drama, The Lost Colony, at the Waterside Theater in Manteo. Most of the materials in this subseries relate to historical productions of The Lost Colony, including programs, playbills, event programs, and publicity. Included in this subseries are the program and playbill for the inaugural performance in of the production in 1937. In addition to The Lost Colony materials, this subseries also includes documents related to RIHA as an organization, including early promotional and membership materials from the mid-1930s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Businesses subseries contains materials created by or related to various business operating in Dare County. The materials in this subseries primarily consist of brochures and pamphlets, restaurant menus, flyers, coupons, advertisements, and other printed material. Businesses represented include retail stores, restaurants, hotels and motels, healthcare service providers, transportation, and public media, as well as some businesses that operate under the aegis of the State of North Carolina (such as Roanoke Island Festival Park and the North Carolina Aquarium). Folders labeled "accommodations" may include documentation of vacation rental cottages, campgrounds, and other types of accommodations, in addition to hotels, motels, and inns.

did.unittitle: Walter Greshams Outer Banks Calendar [2 folders]
did.container: Walter Greshams Outer Banks Calendar [2 folders]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains flyers, brochures, pamphlets, programs, posters, and (occasionally) planning materials and reports related to events held in and around Dare County, or organized by Dare County groups. Events include concerts, anniversaries, celebrations, dramatic performances (including documentation of works by local playwright lebame houston), exhibitions, and festivals. The Festivals folder includes a flyer for the first annual OBX Pridefest, held in 2011. Of note in this subseries are planning materials and publicity for events surrounding America's 400th Anniversary, 1984-1987; commemorative materials from various anniversaries of the Wright Brothers' first flight in 1903; and programs from early instances of the Pirates Jamboree, a multi-day celebration designed to bring vacationers to the Outer Banks in the spring season. In addition to the events documented in this subseries, event flyers and other documentation of events in Dare County may also appear in other subseries, filed under the organizing entity's name.

did.unittitle: Visit of Governors to Dare County
did.container: Visit of Governors to Dare County

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Recreation subseries, 1881-2014 and undated, contains pamphlets and programs related to recreational activities in and around Dare County, such as boating, fishing, and sports. Of note in this subseries are brochures for Camp Seatone, a children's summer camp in Manteo; an 1881 prospectus for the Kitty Hawk Bay Sportsman's Club; and programs from numerous sportfishing tournaments, including the International Blue Marlin Tournament, the Nags Head Surf Fishing Tournament, and fishing tournaments organized by the Pirate's Cove community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains circulars, pamphlets, brochures, event flyers, reports, and other printed material related to Dare County offices, government, and public services. Included in this subseries are materials related to parks, monuments, memorials, and other public spaces in Dare County, as well as promotional materials produced by Dare County's municipal offices.

did.unittitle: Dare County Department of Adult Services
did.container: Dare County Department of Adult Services

did.unittitle: Dare County Parks and Recreation Department
did.container: Dare County Parks and Recreation Department

did.unittitle: United States Coast Guard Group Cape Hatteras
did.container: United States Coast Guard Group Cape Hatteras

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Real Estate subseries, 1927-2016 and undated, contains promotional brochures and pamphlets related to real estate in Dare County. Materials in this collection document homes marketed for sale in the Outer Banks as well as vacation rental properties maintained by various rental companies. Documents may be arranged by company (such as Sun Realty or Britt Real Estate) or by neighborhood/community (such as First Flight Village, Mirlo Beach, or Pirate's Cove) as appropriate. Of note in this subseries is an early booklet (1927) advertising the Virginia Dare Shores community, one of the earliest housing subdivisions on the Outer Banks, developed by Frank Stick in present-day Kill Devil Hills.

did.unittitle: Outer Banks Beach Club (Kill Devil Hills)
did.container: Outer Banks Beach Club (Kill Devil Hills)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series primarily consist of historical sketches, flyers, and programs for events and services conducted at three Dare County churches: Manteo Baptist Church, Mt. Olivet United Methodist Church, and St. Andrew's By-the-Sea Episcopal Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material related to local elections held in Dare County, including sample ballots for Dare County residents and campaign materials created by various candidates. Materials in this subseries only relate to local elections; documentation of state and national campaigns can be found in the State of North Carolina series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to the state of North Carolina generally, as well as regions within the state. Materials include brochures, event programs, published editions of speeches and memorial tributes, political circulars and campaign materials, tourists' guides, and other printed material. Materials are arranged into five subseries: State Agencies and Organizations, 1850-2015 and undated; Events, 1866-2003; Recreation, 1915-2001; and Political Ephemera, 1825-2016 and undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The State Agencies and Organizations subseries, 1850-2015 and undated, contains materials created by or related to various clubs, professional and trade groups, organizations, agencies, and offices active in the state of North Carolina. Included in this subseries are documents related to individual divisions, departments, and offices within the North Carolina state government, including the North Carolina General Assembly and Office of the Governor. Materials primarily include pamphlets, brochures, event flyers, reports, form letters, and promotional material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Events subseries, 1866-2003, contains materials related to anniversaries, celebrations, cultural events, memorials, unveilings, and conferences held in the state of North Carolina. Materials include programs, fliers, speech transcripts, and calendars. Of note in this subseries are programs from numerous state fairs and exhibitions, including the North Carolina State Fair.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to travel and tourism throughout the state of North Carolina. The bulk of the subseries consists of travel brochures for various regions in the state.

did.unittitle: Travel Brochures: Cape Fear Region [2 folders]
did.container: Travel Brochures: Cape Fear Region [2 folders]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Political Ephemera subseries contains campaign flyers, propaganda, and circulars relating to state and national elections held in North Carolina. The folder of Campaign Materials and Propaganda, 1845-1898 and undated (box 79), primarily contains political circulars in support of particular candidates or campaign platforms, including two pieces of Reconstruction-era white supremacist propaganda: a statement on the "Lessons of the Wake Republican Convention" of 1898 warning against black citizens rising to power within the Republican party and a circa 1870s resolution passed by the conservative white citizens of Cross Creek Township praising congressional candidate Alfred Moore Waddell for his opposition to civil rights and social equality for African Americans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials created by the University of North Carolina System and its individual campuses, primarily the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, the University of North Carolina at Greensboro, and North Carolina State University, and East Carolina University. Documentation of individual schools primarily consists of printed material distributed to current and prospective students, such as handbooks, directories, promotional brochures, commencement programs, and informational circulars. This series also includes a folder of material related to the consolidation of the University of North Carolina System, circa 1930s-1948.

did.unittitle: North Carolina School of the Arts
did.container: North Carolina School of the Arts

did.unittitle: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Greensboro [2 folders]
did.container: University of North Carolina at Greensboro [2 folders]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials created by national and federal organizations, as well as material related to the state of Virginia. Materials primarily consist of pamphlets, brochures, published reports, public notices, and form letters. Most of the materials in this series relate directly or indirectly to the North Carolina coastal region. The first two folders in the series document a proposed plan by Mobile Oil Company to conduct offshore drilling off the coast of North Carolina in the early 1990s. The United States Postal Service Commemorative Postage primarily commemorates significant events in coastal North Carolina history, such as the birth of Virginia Dare and the Wright Brothers' first flight.
